samples.commui
Class EmailDobView

java.lang.Object
  samples.ui.View
      samples.commui.CommunityView
          samples.commui.EmailDobView

public class EmailDobView
extends CommunityView

EmailDobView is a screen for capturing a user's email address and date of birth for new account creation. It contains a text entry field for email address and a date entry field (text entry field with modified behavior) for date of birth entry.

Input restrictions are listed in the comments for the validate() method.

Method Detail

handleFocusChanged

public void handleFocusChanged()
Special display behavior for date entry field: if focus is not on the date entry field, and it is empty, then display the date format string in it (e.g., "MM/DD/YYYY"). If the date entry field does get focus, and contains the date format string, then empty it out so the user can type their date of birth.

Overrides:
handleFocusChanged in class CommunityView

keyPressed

public void keyPressed(int key)
For each key pressed while this View is active, implements special display and event processing behavior for date entry field:
  1. Disallow user from using the left/right keys to move the cursor back into the text
  2. Automatically insert date separator characters after the first two pairs of numerals entered. E.g., after the user enters "11" for the month, insert a separator: "11/". After the user then enters two more numerals for the day: "11/23", insert another separator: "11/23/"
  3. Automatically delete the separator characters as the user presses the DELETE key. E.g., if the date starts as: "11/23/1", and the user presses DELETE once, the date string would then read: "11/23"

Overrides:
keyPressed in class View
Parameters:
key - The key code for the key that was pressd.

validate

protected boolean validate()
Validates email address and date of birth, according to rules specified in validateEmail() and validateAge().

Returns:
true if email and date of birth validate

validateEmail

public boolean validateEmail(java.lang.String email)
Email validation rules:
  • Must have exactly one '@' character
  • Must have valid characters before the '@' sign: all alphumeric, '_', '-', '.' and '+'
  • Valid characters after the '@' sign: alphanumeric, '.', and '-'
  • Domain portion must have at least one period, and never two or more adjacent to each other
  • There must be at least 1 character in the first subdomain before the first period after the '@' sign.
  • Last domain extension must have between 2 and 4 characters

Parameters:
email - The email address to validate
Returns:
true if the email address validates

validateAge

public java.util.Date validateAge(java.lang.String dob)
Date of birth parsing rules:
  • Date must be in format MM/DD/YYYY or DD/MM/YYYY (the choice of which format is used is set by a .jad file parameter.)
  • The MM and DD part of the date must always be two characters, so day "7" must be entered as "07"
  • Birthdates before 1885 rejected (max known human age is 120).
  • Date must be a valid calendar date. Leapyears (Feb. 29th on years divisible by 4, etc.) are accounted for.

Parameters:
dob - Date of birth in string format, either: MM/DD/YYYY or DD/MM/YYYY
Returns:
Date instance if string parsed as a valid date, null otherwise

isOldEnough

public boolean isOldEnough(java.util.Date dob,
                           int minAge)
Receives a date, determines if a person born on that date is at least minAge years old today.

Parameters:
dob - Date of birth
minAge - minimum years age
Returns:
true if person born on date dob is at least minAge years old.
